item.title: Hijacking System Programs
item.description: Let’s say for a moment that you are a graduate student, with shell access to your schools server. The server maintains a number of tools you need for classes, and research.  All is well, except the stock editor on the server is wicked old.  Like an eternity old.  Well that happened to me. I am fully addicted to my custom vim configuration, but it requires vim7.3.  My school’s server only has 7.0.  So, how does one install their own application with root privledges?  You create a private root.
